statement.tex: %text Write the value of the determinant % \left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 5 & 6 & 8 \\ 6x & 9x & 12x \end{array}\right\vert?

step.context: %text If two rows or columns of a determinant are proportional, what is the value of such a determinant? %
step.reason: %text If two rows or columns of a determinant are proportional, we can factor out that value which would make the said rows (or columns) identical. From this point on subtracting the two identical rows (or columns) ensures that the determinant reduces to zero. %

step.context: \left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 5 & 6 & 8 \\ 6x & 9x & 12x \end{array}\right\vert \\ %text Are any two rows or columns of the above determinant proportional? %
step.tex: %text No. No two rows or columns of the above determinant are proportional. %
step.reason: \left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 5 & 6 & 8 \\ 6x & 9x & 12x \end{array}\right\vert \\ %text In the above determinant $R_3=3x\times R_1$. Therefore, we can rewrite the determinant as, % 3x\left\vert\begin{array}{ccc} 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 5 & 6 & 8 \\ 2 & 3 & 4 \end{array}\right\vert \\ %text Therefore, the value of this determinant is zero. %
